entry.title: Interface Execution Summary/Exception Alert for Logging/Monitoring and Debugging
entry.content:
Use case - As part of debugging/monitoring, commonly used approach is sending mail alert in exception sub process to the application maintenance team (here in refer as AM Team). Also, sending a success execution summary mail with relevant interface details is send across to AM team or user depending on business requirement.

Challenge - Tracer logs data for 10mins and at near real-time. In cases where AM team needs more data for debugging post runtime execution, info level data in the monitoring log is not adequate for debugging. In complex interfaces with modular flows and process directs, tracing the flow execution gets consuming.

Approach - Keeping above points in thought, below is solution which I have applied in my design which is reusable. It is combination of below -

  • groovy script
  • custom header
  • content modifier

Implementation - 

1. Content Modifier - Set a variable with a custom text message according to your iflow logic. Key is to - set a logical text message which assist the Developer or AM Team to understand - which logic checkpoint is cleared or failed and why. This text message will appear in custom header and also in mail. One can set Content Modifier in Router branches, LIP, Exception subprocess, Multicast branches, before/after request reply call etc. as seem suited.

I am using variable - 'FlowExecutionStatusMsg' in Content modifier and Groovy script 

2. Below is the reusable Groovy Script which you can place in script collection or use locally in iflow. This needs to be placed in Exception Subprocess for Mail Alert and also at end of iflow for Interface Execution Summary Mail (optional). It captures the camel exception and runtime properties, headers and payload along with the custom text message set in the flow at the runtime.

/* Title - GS_InterfaceExecutionSummary.groovyscript.                  Objective - Groovy Script For Interface Execution Summary Mail ; captures runtime error, headers, properties and payload.
*/

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message
//import groovy.json.JsonOutput
import java.text.SimpleDateFormat

Message processData(Message message) {
   
    def messageLog = messageLogFactory.getMessageLog(message)
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ//get message components
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇdef body = message.getBody(String)
    def headers = message.getHeaders()
    def properties = message.getProperties()
   
    // Sort headers and properties alphabetically
    def sortedHeaders = headers.sort { it.key }
    def sortedProperties = properties.sort { it.key }

    // Get timestamp in system timezone (runtime)
    def sdf = new SimpleDateFormat("yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss z")
    def currentTimestamp = sdf.format(new Date())
   
    //for attachment file
    def label = "FlowLog_" + currentTimestamp.replace(" ", "_").replace(":", "-")
   
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ// get custom logger details from flow
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇdef FlowExecutionStatusMsg = properties.get("FlowExecutionStatusMsg") ?: "Not Set"
    def Iflow_Name = properties.get("Iflow_Name") ?: "Not Set"
    def MPL_id = properties.get("SAP_MessageProcessingLogID") ?: "Not Set"

    // Exception
    def exceptionRaw = properties.get("CamelExceptionCaught")
    def exceptionDetails = ""
    if (exceptionRaw)
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ{
        def exMsg = exceptionRaw.getMessage() ?: exceptionRaw.toString()
        def exType = exceptionRaw.getClass().getSimpleName()
        exceptionDetails = """

Exception Type: ${exType}
Message       : ${exMsg}

Stack Trace:
${exceptionRaw.toString()}
"""
    } else {
        exceptionDetails = "--- NO Exception Captured ---"
    }

    // Start of Build HTML body
    def html = new StringBuilder()
    html.append("<html><body>")
    html.append("<p><strong>Hello Team,</strong></p>")
    html.append("<p><strong>Kindly find Interface Execution Summary below :</strong></p>")
   
  //summary table start‚ÄÇ
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇhtml.append("<table border='1' cellpadding='5' cellspacing='0'>")
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇhtml.append("<tr><td><b>Flow Name: </b></td><td> ${Iflow_Name}</td></tr>")
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇhtml.append("<tr><td><b>Flow Execution CustomLogMessage :</b></td><td> ${FlowExecutionStatusMsg}</td></tr>")
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇhtml.append("<tr><td><b>MPL ID :</b></td><td> ${MPL_id}</td></tr>")
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇhtml.append("<tr><td><b>Timestamp:</b></td><td> ${currentTimestamp}</td></tr>")
    html.append("<tr><td><b>Refer to Attachment in SAP IS Monitoring : FileName - </b></td><td> ${label}</td></tr>")
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇhtml.append("<tr><td><b>Exception Details : </b></td><td> ${exceptionDetails} </td></tr>")
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇhtml.append("<tr><td><b>Message Payload Body At Runtime Step: </b></td><td> ${body} </td></tr>")
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇhtml.append("</table><br>")
//summary table end

//start of properties table
    html.append("<h4>Exchange Properties</h4>")
    html.append("<table border='1' cellpadding='5' cellspacing='0'>")
    html.append("<tr><th>Property Name</th><th>Value</th></tr>")
    sortedProperties.each
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ{ k, v ->
        html.append("<tr><td>${k}</td><td>${v}</td></tr>")
    }
    html.append("</table><br>")
//end of properties table

//headers start table
    html.append("<h4>Message Headers</h4>")
    html.append("<table border='1' cellpadding='5' cellspacing='0'>")
    html.append("<tr><th>Header Name</th><th>Value</th></tr>")
    sortedHeaders.each
‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ‚ÄÇ{ k, v ->
        html.append("<tr><td>${k}</td><td>${v}</td></tr>")
    }
    html.append("</table><br>")
//headers end table
   
    html.append("<p>Kindly Do Not Reply to this auto-generated mail.Please contact SAP-Integration Support Team for further investigation.</p>")
    html.append("<p>Regards,<br> SAP CPI Admin</p>")    

    html.append("</body></html>")

    // Note - Set Mail Adapter MIME type to "text/html"
    def logMessage = html.toString()
    message.setBody(logMessage)
   
    // Log Attachment + Custom Header Property
    if (messageLog != null)
    {
    messageLog.addAttachmentAsString(label, logMessage, "text/html")
    messageLog.addCustomHeaderProperty("FlowExecutionStatusMsg", FlowExecutionStatusMsg)
    }
    message.setProperty("MailLogBody", logMessage)
   
    return message
}

Below are steps/code snippets and configuration need to be done in the interface -

Add Custom text message (logically for your debugging/monitoring) as per the Interface flow. 

Add Iflow name which acts as identifier in complex mutliple flows development and will be displayed in mail too.

Mail configuration: I have used externalization for ease of code transport. 

Configure From, To, Subject with specific details.

Mail body has the value set by the groovy output, which would be visible in the outlook mail.

In Monitoring tab, Custom Header below will reflect the custom text message set in the content modifier.

The attachment Flow log with the timestamp is set by the groovy script and would be visible in Monitoring tab for later debugging. It would have the runtime execution details.

The Mail body would consist of below details - Summary table, Properties and Headers. (I have scrubbed data for usage) 

This can be altered in the groovy script as per one's use case requirement. 

Hope this assist you in smoother debugging. 

P.S - This is my first blog despite spending a decade in Integration space, hope to invest time and effort consciously in blogging henceforth after project implementations going forth. Thanks.

entry.title: Re: Default Output GST Tax Code by Warehouse Code in Sale...
entry.content:
Hi,

Use below FMS query

SELECT DISTINCT 'ZR' FROM RDR1 T0 WHERE $[$38.24.11] = 'HQ'

Note: Change tax code ZR to your code and ware house code HQ to your warehouse.

Thank you,

Nagarajan

entry.title: Re: Handling units with MTO: Sales order to be filled aut...
entry.content:
Hi Felix14,

handling units (HU) in repetitive manufacturing or discrete/process manufacturing does not have direct reference to a sales order. See also reply from Lakshmipathi.

If you create a planned HU in transaction MFP1, then sales order reference is not supported.

But if you create a realized HU in transaction MFP2/MFP22, then you get the sales order reference under certain circumstances.
Refer to SAP note https://me.sap.com/notes/2524903 "MFP22: Posting the HUs to the sales order stock"
Once you created a HU in transaction MFP22, then there is a flag/check box "sales order stock". If this check box is set and you press the button "Confirm HU (online)", then you navigate to transaction MFHU and here the sales order is filled. See attached screenshot.

The transaction MFHU is a multifunctional transaction, so all fields are available, even if they aren't needed for some actions.

I hope that this reply is helpful for you.

Best regards,
Barƒ±≈ü

Nagarajan

entry.title: The Next Phase in the Deprecation of the Classic Experience in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
As mentioned in the External Blog Post Important Notice: Changes in SAP Analytics Cloud Classic Stories & Analytic Applications, SAP Analytics Cloud has been in a phased approached to transition customers to the Optimized Experience.

With the 2025 Q3 QRC, SAP Analytics Cloud is entering its next phase. It reinforces our commitment to delivering a modern, high-performance, and consistent user experience within Business Data Cloud (BDC).

What‚Äôs Changing?

With this phase, customers will no longer be able to create new Classic Stories or Analytic Applications. For example, clicking on a new Canvas or Responsive Page in the Stories Module will now automatically launch the Optimized Story Experience instead of prompting the Designer in choosing between Optimized Story Experience and Classic Story Experience. It ensures that all new content benefits from the performance, usability, and functional improvements available.

  • üîí Creation of New Classic Stories and Applications is now DISABLED
  • ‚úÖ Existing Classic Assets (Stories and Analytic Application) remain EDITABLE and FULLY MAINTAINABLE

Continued Access to Existing Classic Assets

Even though new content creation in classic is disabled, existing Classic Stories and Analytic Applications can still be maintained. Our definition of maintainable includes:

  • View, Edit, and Save Content
  • Share, Duplicate, and Delete

‚ö†Ô∏è Continued access to Classic Assets remains until the full deprecation in the 2026 Q2 QRC where these assets will no longer be accessible. It means that customers should begin the migration to the Optimized Experience prior to this date.

Enhancements to File Repository and Object Management

With this phase, we‚Äôve made several usability improvements in how assets are presented and managed:

  • Visual Distinction: The File Repository now provides a clear visual distinction between Classic and Optimized Stories as well as Analytical Applications
  • (Deprecated) Labeling: Deprecated object types now include a ‚Äú(Deprecated)‚Äù suffix in their type
  • Granular Filtering: Object Type Filtering now has more granularity to filter between Classic Stories (Deprecated), Analytical Applications (Deprecated), and Stories

 

Streamlining the User Interface

We‚Äôve taken additional steps to simplify the user experience by removing entry points that led to these deprecated assets. For example:

  • Analytic Applications module no longer has a create button. It still displays the most recent Analytic Applications.
  • Stories module no longer has Smart Discovery or Grid Pages as selectable tiles
  • Clicking Canvas, Responsive, or Template now opens the Optimized Story instead of prompting the Designer in choosing between Optimized Story Experience and Classic Story Experience
  • Modeller module no longer has a Point of Interest Tab to create new Point of Interests
  • Actions from a Model to Create a new Canvas or Responsive opens the Optimized Story

 

Increasing Awareness for the Designer

Within the Classic Experience (Stories and Analytic Applications), we‚Äôve increased the severity of our Deprecation Warning to a Deprecation Notice. It appears in a more prominent indicator reminding the Designer that the Classic Asset will be disabled starting mid-2026. This warning is only shown to Story Designers, the users best positioned to initiate migration.

 

Preparing for Full Deprecation in 2026

This phase marks a significant milestone in our journey toward unifying and modernizing the SAP Analytics Cloud experience. We encourage all customers to begin or continue transitioning their Classic Stories and Analytic Applications to the Optimized Experience before the 2026 Q2 QRC to avoid any disruption. There are a few resources that we recommend.

Mass Migration Tool

With the 2024 Q4 QRC, we had released a Mass Migration Tool for Designers to migrate up to 50 assets to the Optimized Experience. There are a few steps that are involved which includes:                                              

  1. Selection of Assets
  2. Conversion Check & Status
  3. Conversion Settings
  4. Conversion Summary

You can learn more in the External Blog Post, Bulk Migration Tool to Convert Classic Assets to the Optimized Experience

Mass Deletion Tool for System Admins

With the 2025 Q2 QRC, within the System Overview ‚Äì Housekeeping, we had introduced an option for System Administers to delete specific objects, without the need of manual deletion object by object. There is a Last Access Date which helps System Administrators understand which objects are not actively used. 

But it doesn‚Äôt stop there. In addition to the primary object, all dependent objects are also automatically deleted. It means you no longer need to worry about unnecessary and unused objects adding up in your system and slowing down its performance.

You can learn more in the External Blog Post, Efficient Data Maintenance in SAP Analytics Cloud System Overview - Housekeeping

‚ö†Ô∏è For Stories we do not support the distinction between Classic and Optimized Experience. It will be made available in a future release.

Resources

  • Important Notice: Changes in SAP Analytics Cloud Classic Stories & Analytic Applications
  • Bulk Migration Tool to Convert Classic Assets to Optimized Experience
  • The New Table Building Experience in SAP Analytics Cloud (includes Blended Table)
  • Optimized Experience Restrictions & Discontinued Features
  • Mass Deletion Tool for System Administrators

entry.title: Re: Prevent empty version columns in table for version‚Äêre...
entry.content:
@Eliram_Lugassi 

If you have both the restricted measures and the version in the Table axis, this behavior is as expected. It will create a cartesian combination of both restricted measures with all versions. Ideally if you are restricting the measure with a version , you should not be having version dimension also in the axis. Just enable the constant selection feature in the restricted measure. Once you have the version restricted as constant selection you can get rid of the version dimension. If you need to keep both then you need to do some Advance Filtering.

 

Nikhil

entry.title: Growth Rebate in Condition Contract
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We wants to reward our customers that grow their purchase value by more than 15% YoY. Rebates are only applicable if current-year sales exceed base year by a defined percentage.

 For e.g -   Base year: 2024 - Target year: 2025 - Incentive: 5% rebate on incremental sales exceeding 15% growth

Does this scenario us possible in standard CCM S/4 HANA 2023 ? if yes How? 

Thank You

entry.title: Re: need information - modify database SAP
entry.content:
Hi,

Insert/update/delete statements are not allowed to change any SAP B1 tables. If any issue of this action, SAP will reject and not provide any solution.

Refer this previous thread,

https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/i-need-to-create-select-insert-and-delete-method-for-exsisting-table/qaq-p/505902

Thank you,

Nagarajan

entry.title: Re: INVOICED PRUCHASE ORDERS
entry.content:
In ME2L itself, you have the option to filter based on Selection Parameter which should be WEIN, so that this will display POs with both GR and invoice postings. Once the report displays check the below two columns and you can conclude that

  • Still to be Invoiced Quantity/Value: If zero, the PO is fully invoiced.
  • Invoice Document Number: If populated, the PO has been invoiced.

entry.title: Re: PO price Change-Approval process
entry.content:
Hi,

Try this,

SELECT DISTINCT 'True'
FROM OPOR T0
INNER JOIN POR1 T1 ON T0."DocEntry" = T1."DocEntry"
INNER JOIN OCRD T2 ON T0."CardCode" = T2."CardCode"
INNER JOIN ITM1 T3 ON T1."ItemCode" = T3."ItemCode"
AND T3."PriceList" = T2."ListNum"
WHERE $[$38.14.NUMBER] <> T3."Price"

Thank you,

Nagarajan

entry.title: Re: Where to control when the accrual calendar runs? Accr...
entry.content:
Hi @laurasanchezf 

For accrual automation, "Accrual Creation Offset [Days]" is used execute the accrual automation without any manual action.

In the required time account, if you are setting "Level Of Accrual Automation" drop down as "Automatic Accrual Creation" then you have to maintain value in "Accrual Creation Offset [Days]". 

Example 

1. if you need to auto-accrue the time account for every future years on 01st Jan then you need to maintain the "Accrual Creation Offset [Days]" value as "1"

2. For 2026, if you need to auto-accrue the time account in 01st June 2025 then you need to maintain the "Accrual Creation Offset [Days]" value as "-183". 

Above requirement can be configured based on the business requirement. 

To configure the accrual posting date, you have to customise the "Accrual Rule" mapped in the time account type. 

Considering your example:- "Accrual to happen six months after the validity of my annual account"  - for this requirement, you have work only on the posting date. Refer the below screenshot.

Recommend to try the use cases/scenario in test environment. If it is working as per the expectation then deploy it in production.

Thanks

Arun

entry.title: Re: query Delivery return - read current doc no.
entry.content:
Hi,

Try this query,

SELECT T1.[DocEntry], T0.[DocNum], T0.[CardName], T0.[DocDate], T1.[ItemCode], T1.[Dscription], T1.[Quantity], T2.[U_NAME] FROM ORDN T0 INNER JOIN RDN1 T1 ON T0.[DocEntry] = T1.[DocEntry] INNER JOIN OUSR T2 ON T0.[UserSign] = T2.[USERID]

Thank you,

Nagarajan

entry.title: Re: We have a requirement to schedule all existing batch jobs using bgRFC. Is it possible
entry.content: For the first and last questions: background jobs are used to run heavy tasks as there is no timeout (no time limit). They may start immediately or at scheduled time or after other jobs (during lesser activity e.g. the night). RFC is to start some small tasks immediately or as soon as possible, on the same system or on a remote system. It's better suited for parallelization. Background jobs may also start small units of work in RFC. RFC has timeout. Depending on each requirement, choose one or the other, it's non-sense to start all in background or all in bgRFC.don't

entry.title: how create validation for OSPP table -HANA DB
entry.content:
Dear team,

Can you guide how to create validation for Special price  

CNT1:=0;
IF :OBJECT_TYPE='7' AND (:TRANSACTION_TYPE='A' OR  :TRANSACTION_TYPE='U') THEN
 
 
 
select count("CardCode") INTO CNT1 from ospp ---TO_NVARCHAR(CURRENT_TIME, 'HH24:MI')
where ifnull("U_LeadBy",'')=''  and ifnull("ItemCode",'')<>'' and ("ItemCode"||"CardCode")=:list_of_cols_val_tab_del ;
 IF :CNT1>0 THEN
        ERROR := 122;
       ERROR_MESSAGE := 'pls updateU_LeadBy ';
     END IF;
END IF;

entry.title: Re: Growth Rebate in Condition Contract
entry.content:
On your comment, ‚Äúreward only if 2025 sales exceed 2024 by 15%‚Äù, YoY growth-based rebates are not directly supported. You‚Äôll need to simulate the growth logic using custom condition base values or enhancement. Try the below approach

Create Two Condition Contracts; one for Contract A (Base Year ‚Äì 2024) where you can capture actual sales volume and Contract B (Target Year ‚Äì 2025) to define rebate condition with a threshold.  These two condition types to be inserted to your existing pricing procedure which is related to CCM or you can copy the existing PP and create a new PP where you can add these two condition types.

Use Custom Condition Base Value Routine via VOFM to calculate

  • 2025 sales volume
  • Compare it to 2024 volume
  • Apply rebate only if growth > 15%

Use a percentage-based condition (e.g., 5% rebate). Apply it only to the incremental volume exceeding the 15% threshold. Run periodic settlement or final settlement to generate credit memos. Use delta accruals if needed to adjust monthly postings.

If you are not a SD consultant, ask your SD consultant to try the above approach.

entry.title: Blog: Managing Master Inspection Charactersitics (MICs) through ABAP
entry.content:
This post is still a work in progress...


In this blog post I will post an overview of how to manage MICs through an ABAP program
There are no dedicated BAPIs for MIC handling.

The FM 'BAPI_QPMK_SAVEREPLICA' will be used instead of various BAPIs to Create, Change and Delete MICs

Creating new MIC

Use FM 'BAPI_QPMK_SAVEREPLICA'
Input tables: 

  • MSTCHA (Master Characteristic Data)
    Key data for the MIC:
    • FUNCTION: Set to '009' for creating new MIC
    • PLANT_QPMK: Plant that MIC should be associated with
    • MSTR_CHAR: The Master Characteristic Number you want to be associated with the new MIC. 
      Find the number range setting in SPRO IMG ‚Üí Quality Management ‚Üí Quality Planning ‚Üí Basic Data ‚Üí Inspection Characteristic ‚Üí Define Number Ranges. If a number range is maintained as internal then you can leave this field blank and that number range will be used. Otherwise use FM 'NUMBER_GET_NEXT' for object 'QMERKNR' and provide the interval key maintained in SNRO. 
    • VMSTR_CHAR: Version nr, set as '000001' for new MIC
    • VALID_FROM: Set as desired
    • QLOESCHKZ: Release status of MIC. Set as '2' for "released". Set as '1' for "Being created" if you do not want to release MIC immediately.
    • QVOLLST: Copy Model/Reference Characteristic. Initial for "Incomplete Copy Model", '1' for "Complete copy model" and 'X' for "Reference characteristic".
    • IND_CONTROL: This field represents the Characteristic Control Indicator selections. I have not found definitive documentation for how to de-/encode this field. I recommend having a template MIC and copying the corresponding QPMK-STEUERKZ field. 
  • MSTCHA_TEXT
    Text data for the MIC:
    • PLANT_QPMK; Provide the same plant as in the Key structure
    • MSTR_CHAR: Provide the same Master Characteristic Number as in the Key structure. If using an internal number range, you must pre-allocate it by calling the 'NUMBER_GET_NEXT' FM (OBJECT = 'QMERKMALE', SUBOBJECT = <plant>, NR_RANGE_NR = '<your internal interval>'). Remember to apply CONVERSION_EXIT_ALPHA_INPUT.
    • VMSTR_CHAR: Provide the same version as in the Key structure
    • VALID_FROM: Provide the same valid from as in the Key structure
    • LANGU/LANGU_ISO: Provide the language that they text should be active for or leave blank for system language.
    • CHAR_DESCR: Provide short text
    • IND_MST_CHA_LTEXT: Flag whether long text exists

entry.title: Re: Unable to Update Bank Directories in Bulk
entry.content:
1. Use the Import Bank Directories app to upload bank directories in bulk.
  2. Upload the relevant files and compare them with the existing bank data.
  3. Save the new and modified data into the bank master table using a global bank directory.

entry.title: Re: Email notifications for the buyer when a Goods Receip...
entry.content:
Ensure Buyer Has a Valid Email in SAP User Master su01. Under Address, make sure the email address is maintained in the Communication section. If the buyer is not a SAP user, you‚Äôll need to use a generic email address or create a dummy user with the correct email. In MN21, you can consider a Partner Function like PE or Created By. SAP then uses the partner data from the PO or GR document to identify the relevant user. If that user has a valid email address maintained in SU01, and the output method is set to External Send, the system routes the email accordingly.

Finally and most importantly, ensure Requirement 171 is assigned to MLGR in the procedure. This requirement ensures the output triggers only when a GR or SES is posted.

In on premise there is one configuration point to assign the FI-CA document type to the edocument type that seems to be missing in Public cloud. The link in on premise SPRO is this one:

IMG/Funciones de aplicaci√≥n generales/eDocument/Parametrizaciones generales/Assign eDocument Type to Accounting Document Type for FI-CA (TVFKEDOCV)

With the edocument type you can assign different types whenever the Invoice is an incoming invoice, outgoing invoice, adjustment invoice:

This configuration point, is not presented in SAP public cloud for FI-CA neither CI documents. It is just presented for FI and SD billing documents:

 

I‚Äôm not sure if we can activate any scope item in order to add this point of configuration for FI-CA documents. The scope items 5XU and 78L have been already activated.

In other hand, In the SAP documentation, I have found this:

Configuration Options for Key Users in Contract Accounting | SAP Help Portal

I can not see in this documentation where I can assign the edocument type for FI-CA.

Right now as I can not assign the edocument type, edocument is failing with the incoming invoices:

The system seems to be selecting for all the documents the SII Outgoing Invoice.

Could someone help me to see where can I assign the edocument type to the FI-CA document in SAP Public cloud?

Thanks

 

#FI-CA #BRIM  #CI #SAP PUBLIC CLOUD

entry.title: Re: Data Migration Cockpit - QM Inspection Plan PLKN (Gro...
entry.content:
Dear Yuri6542,

thank you for the details provided. 

The field PLNKN is an internal counter, there is no option to add/change it via transaction QP01/QP02 or via BAPI BAPI_INSPECTIONPLAN_CREATE either. As the migration object for inspection plan is based on the BAPI, it is not an option to update the PLNKN with the migration cockpit either. It should be assigned internally, automatically.

I wish you a nice day,
‚ÄãAlbert
‚Äã***
‚ÄãRead and follow the 'SAP Community Rules of Engagement' at
‚Äãhttps://www.sap.com/community/about/rules-of-engagement.html

entry.title: Re: To avoid the DIV/ERROR in a calculated measure
entry.content:
Put an IF stmt around it to check that the denominator is not zero or null.

IF (ISNULL([FC1 2025]) OR [FC1 2025] = 0, null, [Strategy 2026]/[FC1 2025] - 1)

 Any help would be appreciated.

Best,
Peter

entry.title: Re: GRIR has a positive open balance Error
entry.content:
Some of the possible causes are

  • even if quantities match, exchange rate differences, delivery costs, or taxes can cause mismatches. Use transaction MB03 or ME23N to inspect PO history and compare GR and IR amounts line by line.
  • Check if the GR and IR were posted to different GR/IR accounts due to incorrect account determination in OBYC. This can cause the amounts to offset in different places, leaving one account with a residual balance.
  • If IR was posted manually without referencing the GR, the system may not clear the GR/IR account properly. Use FBL3N to analyze line items in the GR/IR account and look for unmatched entries.
  • A partial reversal of GR or IR can leave behind a balance. Check for reversal documents in MBST or MR8M and confirm they match the original postings.

entry.title: Re: CKMLPRKEKO lot size change ?
entry.content:
In your case, why CKMLPRKEKO Lot Sizes vary is because, the LOSGR field in CKMLPRKEKO reflects the lot size used during cost estimate creation, not the standard lot size from the material master. If cost estimates were created manually or via different costing variants, the lot size could have been set arbitrarily or defaulted from templates.

What you can do is go to transaction OKKN and check your costing variant. Under Quantity Structure and Valuation, ensure the lot size determination is consistent across materials. When running cost estimates, explicitly set the desired lot size. If using CK40N for mass costing, you can predefine lot sizes via selection parameters or user exits.

Of course, compare KALNR (Cost Estimate Number) with the corresponding costing runs. This helps trace back which run introduced which lot size.

entry.title: Re: VAKEY field not available in NACH table in S4/HANA
entry.content:
In S/4HANA, direct access to VAKEY is deprecated. You can't rely on it for custom logic or reporting as you did in ECC. SAP recommends reconstructing VAKEY using condition record number and A-table content, rather than accessing it directly.

One workaround is SAP provides CL_COND_VAKEY_SRV to reconstruct VAKEY dynamically. You can use methods from this class in custom ABAP logic to retrieve output determination parameters. Alternatively, you can use RV_CONDITION_RECORD_READ which helps retrieve condition records and can be used to rebuild VAKEY logic indirectly.

Also, have a look at SAP Note 2220005 which outlines data model changes in pricing and condition technique and includes examples for handling VAKEY replacements

entry.title: Re: Missing Post Processing for Odata Inteface - S/4HANA...
entry.content:
Hello @Phil_P,

Thanks for raising this interesting question. It‚Äôs indeed a common challenge people face in S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition.

Below listed are the core issues:

  • OData APIs give you real-time responses and error messages
    But they‚Äôre not supported by AIF, so no monitoring or reprocessing
  • SOAP (async) APIs are AIF-compatible
    But they don‚Äôt return immediate responses

This limitation is confirmed in SAP Note 3405212 and SAP KBAs 3461312 and 3567043.

Unfortunately, hybrid solutions (OData & SOAP) aren‚Äôt supported in the Public Cloud due to extensibility constraints. If both features are critical, I would recommend raising it via the SAP Influence Portal.

For further information, kindly refer to the below SAP link:

Available Monitoring Content

I am happy to discuss options further if needed.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: How to create a measure in SAC that always shows a fixed month value regardless of the data filter
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am working in SAP Analytics Cloud with an import model based on an Excel file.

I need to create a calculated measure that should always display the value of another measure restricted to a specific month (e.g., January), but it should remain visible across all months in the story, even if a date filter is applied.

Example:

  • I have a measure [Legacy Book Value Assets].

  • I want to create another measure that takes only the value of [Legacy Book Value Assets] for January 2025.

  • When I filter the story for June 2025, I still want this "January-based" measure to be displayed for every month (replicated), instead of disappearing because of the date filter.

I tried using a Restricted Measure for January, but when I change the date filter in the story, the measure goes blank.

Is there a way to define this logic directly in the model (calculated measure), so that the value for January remains visible across all months, regardless of the story filters?

Any workaround, formula example, model design best practice would be highly appreciated but please do not consider Data Action solutions.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Re: AATP Supply Protection with "physical stock" protection
entry.content:
Hello,
with Supply Protection it is possible to do this. However, protection has to be seen as "restriction for others". With the default setting of SUP the demand matching the highest priority could get the complete stock (if it comes first) as this demand doesn't need to consider the other protections as restriction.
There are also other settings and various options regarding the restriction logic, how time buckets with protected quantities have to be considered or how the own protected quantities are considered.
There is one quite comprehensive blog I like to recommend: Supply Protection In a Nutshell - SAP Community

entry.title: Re: PYXX_READ_PAYROLL_RESULT not returning some wage types
entry.content: You won't Get all the wage types by using the above FM as some of the wage types might be Indirectly Valuated, please use the following FM RP_FILL_WAGE_TYPE_TABLE and let us know the outcome.

entry.title: Key User Custom Fields: Maximum number of fields and characters
entry.content:
Key User Custom Fields: Maximum number of fields and characters

Have you ever wondered how many key user custom fields you could add to a specific business context? If so, this blog post is for you.

This blog post covers the following topics:

  • The maximum number of key user custom fields you can add
  • The maximum overall number of characters consumed by key user custom fields

Please note that for all S/4HANA editions, the actual numbers for the maximum fields and maximum overall number characters supported strongly depend on the S/4HANA release. In general, the maximum number of fields and the maximum overall number of characters consumed by key user custom fields have been significantly increased over time.

S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

In S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, you can figure out easily how much capacity for a given business context is left. This is directly shown while creating a new field using the Custom Fields app (see screenshot below).

Business Context Capacity

The field ‚ÄúBusiness Context Capacity‚Äù displays a percentage number telling you which percentage of the overall available capacity reserved for customers has already been consumed. When you hover over the ‚ÄúBusiness Context Capacity‚Äù bar, you see how many fields and how many bytes are available (see screenshot). As a rule of thumb, you can divide the number of bytes by factor 2 to get the free number of characters.

Please note that for each business context, the responsible SAP application department defines the capacity available for customers individually. The only guard rail that exists is that the number of fields reserved for customers is never less than 100 fields and never less than 1000 characters.
If the available business context capacity is not sufficient for you, please create a request via the customer influence channel or create a customer ticket on the application component of the respective business context.

S/4HANA and S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition

In S/4HANA and S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, the business context capacity limits are not considered at all. You can add key user custom fields until you reach the technical limits given by ABAP dictionary. As soon as you reach these limits, you'll no longer be able to add additional key user custom fields. A popup will tell you that there is no more space left to create key user custom fields.

These limits are very high. For SAP_BASIS releases above 7.95, no customer has reached these limits yet.

The ABAP dictionary limits relevant in this context are:

  1. The maximum number of fields: the maximum number of fields supported in a database table. Note that for counting them, it's not relevant whether this field is a SAP standard field or not
  2. The maximum table width: this figure tells you how many bytes at max per table entry in a database table are supported. Note that for counting them, it's not relevant whether the bytes originate from a SAP standard field or not

Let‚Äôs have a look at these limits:

  1. Maximum Number of Fields
    • A database table can have up to 749 fields by default
    • Since SAP-BASIS release 7.73, the limit increases to:
      • 1,500 fields for application tables with a 'Column' storage type.
      • 1,000 fields for application tables with a 'Row' storage type
    • Since SAP-BASIS release 9.16, the limit has been further increased to:
      • 3000 fields for application tables with a 'Column' storage type
      • 1,000 fields for application tables with a 'Row' storage type (remained unchanged)
  2. Maximum Table Width
    • By default, the maximum width of a table is 4,030 characters
    • With the TABLEN feature activated (DDIC table DD02L, field TABLEN_FEATURE), the limit increases to 16,293 characters
    • Since SAP-BASIS release 7.95, the table width limit has been extended further to 256,000 characters

With this, we are done. I hope this blog helps you understand what the limits of key user custom fields are regarding number of fields and number of bytes.

Feedback, Comments, or Questions:

You‚Äôre cordially invited to provide them in the comments section below. Please follow my profile to get updates when I publish more posts on these topics.
Feel invited to post and answer questions here (https://answers.sap.com/tags/270c4f37-c335-46e1-bfad-a256637d5e26) and read other posts on the topic (https://blogs.sap.com/tags/270c4f37-c335-46e1-bfad-a256637d5e26/).

I want to thank Yasmina van Rooij (YasminavanRooij), Karsten Schaser (Karsten_Schaser) for their extremely helpful contributions.

Other related blog posts (just a small selection of the blogs available for custom field extensibility)

  • https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/convert-manually-created-append-fields-to-real-key-user-custom-fields/ba-p/13967399
  • https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/key-user-custom-fields-in-s-4hana-cloud-private-edition-and-on-premise-dos/ba-p/14026871
